The width and height of an image have a: The width and height of an image have a fixed ratio, called the aspect ratio. It is written as x:y, where x and y are two numbers. For instance, an image with a 16:9 aspect ratio will always have 16 units of width for every 9 units of height, regardless of its size. So, both an image that is 16 cm wide and 9 cm high and an image that is 32 cm wide and 18 cm high have the same 16:9 aspect ratio.

The three are closely interrelated. You: The three are closely interrelated. You might prioritize video quality, but in doing so, you will have higher latency and a higher bandwidth. Alternatively, you might be limited in bandwidth and have to sacrifice video quality and deal with increased latency. Lower latency and higher video quality results in a higher bandwidth.

Electronic equipment, when powered on, g: Electronic equipment, when powered on, generates heat whether it's active or idle. This heat is measured in British Thermal Units (BTUs). One BTU is approximately 1055 joules, and one watt per hour is equivalent to 3.4 BTUs. It's crucial to calculate the total heat produced by all electronic equipment in an active AV rack.
AV designers typically determine the tot: AV designers typically determine the total BTU for a system and share this information with HVAC engineers. This allows designers to incorporate appropriate cooling solutions to prevent equipment failure and balance HVAC systems for user comfort. Equipment wattage details can often be found in the owner's manual or on the device itself.

Cooling Required follows the industry pr: Cooling Required follows the industry practice of measuring air conditioning cooling capacity in tons. The required capacity is calculated by dividing the BTU/hr heat load by 12,000.
